title: Do Manipal students get a .edu email address? - Quora
tags: Colleges and Universities in Manipal, Karnataka, India

response.answer_text: No, Manipal students dont get a .edu email address. There are a lot of things outside .edu prerequisite. I agree you want to learn from good websites but if you could just learn properly in class/learn from books that will be significant enough. Email id is not a basic need and i personally think only basic needs have to be fulfilled. Its cumbersome to design a .edu email with gmail features and hence .edu will always take a backseat. If i design a better .edu then i'll start a competitive company to google or yahoo.                No, not having a .edu email has no impact while applying to universities abroad. Infact .edu email will be closed once you leave Manipal and admissions abroad normally happen months after you pass out. No NIT's give .edu email to students but still they are good. Even IIT students dont use .edu email as there are lot of issues in it.             Even IIT professors use gmail or other emails though they have .edu email. Instead of having a less useful .edu email its better to use better email IDs.

Yes, one can get a edu mail prefixed with learner @manipal.edu. the regular.edu mail ID are meant for faculties of the university only, that gets blocked once the faculty resigns. However, the learner.edu mail can be used forever. Either of the mail id's are important for many purposes ns the most imp I felt was for higher studies application process and to have an access to follow scientific personnel, publications such as researchgate. For one to have a mail ID, one have to fill a form available with the IT dept with mandatory signature from the HOD. The regular mail ID request will be part of the duty reporting formality kit.

Yes, you will get a .edu email ID after joining Manipal university. the process is fairly simple you will have to fill a form in your first semester and you will be given an email which will usually be <firstname>.<lastname>@learner.manipal.edu depending on availability and you might have to wait for 15-30 days for activation. you can then use this email on several websites to avail offers specially for students. manipal university is one of few indian institutions to give you such privileges most institutes don't even have .edu domain name, they usually have .edu.in which is not valid sub-domain for student emails.  i hope this answers your question :)

They do. You will either receive a maid id with http://learner.manipal.edu. If you do not receive, you will be able to see it on your students portal. It is synced with Microsoft 360 account. You can then use this email on several websites to avail offers for students. Manipal is one of few Indian institutions to give such privileges to students. Most institutes don't even have .edu domain name, they usually have.Edu.in which is not a valid sub-domain for student emails.

Yes !!! Manipal student get @learner.manipal.edu email address . i don't no they provide this for whole Manipal University student but MIT and its associate Technical college student get learner email id for academic purpose ..actually using this id student can submit there online assignment and all other communication go thru this email address.

Yes, you do get an edu email account here in manipal. We have an email account ending with @learner.manipal.eduDon’t loose it, microsoft provides various paid features for free if u sign up using this mail id. For eg- 1 TB of cloud storage on One Drive .

All manipal students get a .edu email id with complete access to loads of microsoft student offerings within few weeks of joining the college. It comes really handy online. I used to order electronic component samples reserved for only buissness professionals from various online electronic sites uding my college id.
All MIT Manipal students do get a .edu email address. It's called a learner id.
Atleast from 2012-2016 batch onwards everyone has got a .edu id. If you don't have a surname, your email id will be e.g. rishabh.mitma2@learner.manipal.edu
yes and its free .. just ask ur dept head or apply in the edu IT dept .. u will get a learner.manipal.edu mail  id in 2 days ..
Yes they do. And it's called a learner's id. And like everybody already said, don't lose it. You'll need it for various purposes.

response.answer_text: A2A You get Page on manipal.edu mail id - every student of MU is eligible to get this
